job_tasks.phrase: You develop and execute test plans, identify and report bugs, and collaborate with our development team to resolve issues.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes traditional software engineering tasks related to testing, bug identification, and collaboration with developers for issue resolution, aligning with the definition of Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: You will work closely with our development team to create and implement comprehensive test plans, perform manual and automated tests, and report on the findings.
job_tasks.justification: This sentence details the creation and execution of test plans, both manual and automated, and reporting, which are core software engineering activities focused on quality assurance.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop, implement, and maintain test plans and test cases
job_tasks.justification: Directly relates to the planning and execution of software testing, a key aspect of software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Execute manual and automated tests to identify software defects
job_tasks.justification: Describes the practical application of testing methodologies to find bugs, which falls under the umbrella of software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified issues
job_tasks.justification: Highlights the collaborative aspect of software engineering, specifically in addressing and fixing defects found during testing.

job_tasks.phrase: Perform regression testing to ensure product stability
job_tasks.justification: Regression testing is a standard software engineering practice to ensure that new changes haven't negatively impacted existing functionality, fitting within Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Document and report test results, and provide feedback for continuous improvement
job_tasks.justification: Reporting and providing feedback on test results are integral parts of the software development lifecycle, aimed at improving product quality.

job_tasks.phrase: Participate in code reviews and provide input on quality assurance standards and processes
job_tasks.justification: Code reviews and input on QA standards are collaborative activities within software development to maintain code quality and process efficiency.

job_tasks.phrase: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in software testing
job_tasks.justification: While related to learning, the context here is specifically about staying current with software testing technologies, which supports the core software engineering function.

soft_skills.justification: This phrase directly maps to the definition of problem-solving skills, a key soft skill for a QA Engineer.
This explicitly mentions collaboration with the development team, a core aspect of communication and collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified issues
soft_skills.justification: Reinforces the collaborative nature of the role, specifically in the context of issue resolution.
Providing feedback is a form of communication aimed at improving processes and outcomes.

soft_skills.phrase: Participate in code reviews and provide input on quality assurance standards and processes
soft_skills.justification: Participating in code reviews and providing input on standards involves communication and collaboration with peers.

soft_skills.phrase: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in software testing
soft_skills.justification: This phrase indicates a need for continuous learning and adaptation to new technologies within the software testing domain.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on Quality Assurance (QA) tasks, such as developing and executing test plans, identifying bugs, performing regression testing, and participating in code reviews. All identified tasks fall under Macro-Category A: Core Software Engineering, specifically '1.A.1. Software Development & Integration'. There are no tasks related to AI/ML model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, or AI-specific data engineering. Therefore, the role is classified as a 'Software Engineer' as it does not involve integrating or developing AI/ML features into the product.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and specific about the responsibilities of a QA Engineer. The tasks described are standard for this role and do not involve any AI/ML components, making the classification straightforward and unambiguous.
